paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on KCNH2 variants associated with long QT syndrome, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient presented with syncope at age 20 and was diagnosed with long QT syndrome at age 22.
This individual suffered a cardiac arrest at age 28 and was diagnosed with long QT syndrome at age 29.
This individual is a carrier but remains asymptomatic.

functional_data.summary: The G601S variant shows impaired trafficking and increased degradation.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on functional assays and family segregation.
variants.additional_notes: The G601S variant is well-characterized in the context of long QT syndrome.
key_quotes: Approximately 90% of LQTS-associated variants cause intracellular protein transport dysfunction.
The G601S variant has significantly increased interactions with proteins responsible for folding, trafficking, and degradation.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: This individual was diagnosed with long QT syndrome at age 36 after experiencing arrhythmias.
This individual is a carrier but remains asymptomatic.

functional_data.summary: The G965* variant shows impaired trafficking and is associated with increased degradation.

variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on functional assays and family segregation.
variants.additional_notes: The G965* variant is associated with a truncation of the protein.
key_quotes: The double mutant lacks the ER retention signal RXR.
The G965* variant has a lower molecular weight than full-length Kv11.1.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text and supplementary tables.
